acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 24-72 hours ErC50=0.069mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the guinea pig LD50 (dermal route) value of 1,000mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 1,000mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)) and 2,000mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 value of 4,450ppm (4 hours), calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (4 hour-inhalation of vapour) of 12.898mg/L and 15.8mg/L (ACGIH (7th, 2004)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (27,400ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 2.77kPa (25degC) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 895mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 891mg/kg, 1,580mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002)), 1,500mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2004)) and 866mg/kg (IARC 77 (2000)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 62% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.65 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN#1282) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale:
The flash point is 20degC (c.c.) and the boiling point is 115degC (ICSC (2000)), which is classified into Category 2. 
Classified into Class 3, Packing Group II (UN#1282) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests and micronucleus tests), described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002), NTP DB (Access on March 2006) and IARC 77 (2000).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 482degC (ICSC, 2000)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of atrophy of the testes/epididymis and prolonged estrus cycles, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) (though no data are available on parental toxicity).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on eye irritation tests in rabbits and guinea pigs (CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002), ATSDR (2000), PATTY (4th, 2000) and ACGIH (7th, 2004)): "severe damage," "corneal damage" and "severe injury." The substance is thus considered "corrosive."

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002) and ACGIH (7th, 2004)): "severe damage" and "corrosion" (though no data are available on 4-hour application). The substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety, if further subclassification is needed.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Local Lymph Node Assay in guinea pigs show "positive" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002)), while skin sensitization tests in guinea pigs are "negative" (ACGIH (7th, 2004)). These equivocal data do not allow the presence or absence of skin sensitization to be determined, and hence classification is not possible.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (liver, kidney, nervous system),
Category 2 (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, nervous system)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "severe damage to the liver and kidney," "headache, dizziness, oversensitiveness, insomnia, nausea, vomiting, hepatopathy, cirrhosis, collapse of the nervous system with speech disorder" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002)), and the evidence from animal studies including "inflammation of the liver" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002)) and "anemia" (NTP TR470 (2000)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (respiratory system, nervous system),
Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (respiratory system, nervous system)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "pulmonary congestion and bronchitis," "effects on nervous system with speech disorder" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-70 (2002)), and the evidence from animal studies including "narcotic effects" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)). Evidence of respiratory toxicity was found following oral ingestion.
